name: CNN
text:
Ocean organisms produce more than half of the world's oxygen, and absorb about a quarter of our carbon dioxide.

But when oceans absorb CO2, they become more acidic and harm marine life: https://t.co/XKtI2m3BfR #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/mDgrPcUhsa

name: CNN
text: The oceans are a significant source of both renewable energy and fossil fuels; but millions of gallons of oil are released into the oceans each year, and it can take decades for an ecosystem to recover from an oil spill: https://t.co/lpNIOoWZ8o #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/0P6fjMBJU3

name: CNN
text:
The oceans play a vital part in regulating our climate and acting as a buffer against global warming.

But the extra heat is making ocean water expand, causing sea levels to rise, threatening coastal communities and bleaching coral reefs: https://t.co/xygfj9oaPS  #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/7uL0OCQoyX

name: CNN
text:
More than 80% of the ocean is still unexplored, and researchers estimate that nine in 10 ocean species have yet to be classified.

However, pollution is damaging ecosystems and harming wildlife https://t.co/verwWFVQDM #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/4mjocIufuT

name: CNN
text:
Globally, around 15% of the protein we eat comes from seafood.

But commercial fishing has led to more than 90% of marine fish stocks becoming fully fished or overfished: https://t.co/E069gqEpBo #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/K6zkpAc1fI

name: CNN
text:
The situation may look bleak, but it's not too late to make a difference.

Experts say marine life could recover to healthy levels in the next 30 years if pressures on the world's oceans -- including climate change -- were addressed now #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/7GnUp7PaAy

name: CNN
text: When it comes to policing and criminal justice, the US is a noticeable outlier among similarly developed nations, and black Americans are disproportionately affected. https://t.co/jcJ0hn57ae

name: CNN
text: A media review by the Bureau of Justice Statistics found a total of 1,348 potential arrest-related deaths in the ten months from June 2015 through March 2016 — an average of 135 deaths per month, or just over four per day. https://t.co/nUcjGtdOKY https://t.co/ZvpVYdMMsn

name: CNN
text: American police also shoot more people than forces in similarly developed countries https://t.co/nUcjGtdOKY https://t.co/ivczUXzpTM

name: CNN
text: A total of 10,310,960 arrests were made in the US in 2018 — that's one arrest made per every 32 American citizens. Those figures give the US a far higher arrest rate than the UK or Australia, among others. https://t.co/nUcjGtdOKY https://t.co/7xphR3JnYV

name: CNN
text: Police officers are more likely to use force on black Americans — and, according to a 2016 study published in the American Journal of Health, black men are nearly three times more likely than white men to be killed by police intervention. https://t.co/nUcjGtdOKY https://t.co/paEJeCjH7A

name: CNN
text: The US has the largest prison population in the world. If every US state were counted as a country, the 31 countries with the highest incarceration rates in the world would all be US states, according to the Prison Policy Initiative. https://t.co/nUcjGtdOKY https://t.co/og3V0Vo48j

name: CNN
text: Black Americans make up a third of the US prison population, despite only making up around an eighth of the country's total population. The UK and Canada suffer similar issues, but not on the scale that the United States does. https://t.co/nUcjGtdOKY https://t.co/s7GZS3pqKK
